conclusion: Analyze the motion of the negatively charged particle in both the electric and magnetic fields.
The particle is injected along the central line SO between the parallel metal plates MN and PQ.
The electric field E between the plates accelerates the particle horizontally.
The particle starts from rest at point S, so its initial velocity v_0 = 0.
The acceleration a of the particle is a = qE/m.
The time t to cross the distance L horizontally between the plates is t = L/v_x.
The horizontal velocity v_x after crossing the electric field is v_x = sqrt(qEL/m).
After exiting the electric field, the particle enters the magnetic field region abcd.
The magnetic field B is perpendicular to the plane of the paper and directed into the paper.
The magnetic field exerts a force F = qvB on the moving particle, causing it to move in a circular path.
The radius R of the circular path is R = mv/qB.
The particle just fails to exit the magnetic field from side cd, meaning R = L.
Setting R = L, the velocity v in the magnetic field is v = qBL/m.
The velocity of the particle when it is shot into point S is the same as the velocity it has when it enters the magnetic field.
The magnitude of the velocity of the particle when it is shot into point S is v = qBL/m.
